column1: I am 18+ and consent to take part. I understand anomymised data will be published openly
column2: Which of the following best describes your current work status?
column3: Do you use any AI-powered tools or features in your work or daily life?
column4: How often do you use digital or AI-powered tools (e.g., ChatGPT, Copilot, Gemini, search assistants, or productivity apps) in your daily life?
column5: I often feel mentally taxed when trying to guide or re-phrase prompts for digital or AI tools to get the result I want.
column6: Figuring out whether digital or AI information is accurate or trustworthy drains my focus and mental energy.
column7: Switching between my own ideas and AI-generated suggestions makes it harder to stay in flow.
column8: I sometimes catch myself thinking about how to think when I use AI or digital systems.
column9: I lose track of what thoughts are mine versus what came from a digital or AI tool.
column10: Even brief sessions with digital or AI tools can leave my mind cluttered or overstimulated.
column11: I rely on digital or AI suggestions to make many everyday work or personal decisions.
column12: When digital or AI advice conflicts with my instinct, I usually follow the system’s recommendation.
column13: I feel less confident making decisions without digital or AI input.
column14: Letting AI or digital systems decide for me saves time but leaves me feeling detached from the outcome.
column15: After following AI advice, I sometimes question whether the decision was truly mine.
column16: Using AI tools blurs the line between my judgment and automation.
column17: I worry that depending on digital or AI systems weakens my independent decision-making over time.
column18: Even after I stop using AI or digital tools, my mind keeps replaying the interaction.
column19: I find it hard to mentally switch off after spending time with digital or AI systems.
column20: I need time away from screens or AI tools to feel like myself again.
column21: Taking short breaks from AI or digital input helps me clear my head.
column22: When I spend a day disconnected from AI or digital systems, my thinking feels calmer and more grounded.
column23: I feel uneasy or restless when I’m not able to use digital or AI tools for long periods.
column24: In your own words, describe how using digital or AI tools affects your ability to think clearly, make decisions, or rest your mind.
column27: Which of the following best describes your gender?

column24: It definitely rests my mind, we're at the point where we are working side-by-side with AI models to help us manage our daily workload, for me atleast. It helps alot to make decisions and gain a much clearer thought.
AI is good for helping me organize my thoughts, but sometimes I worry about too much input from it affecting my decisions or potentially putting me in an echo chamber of sorts.
When I spend too much time on my laptop working intensively and using digital tools, I experience cognitive fatigue and feel the need to rest my mind.
I think it helps with productivity as I use it at a starting point for brief ideas
I don't use AI tools as I'm worried they will affect my ability to think clearly and make balanced decisions.
As the work is done for you.
Sometimes I can be indecisive about whether to use the idea from AI or my own but I overcome the indecision quite quickly.
using ai makes me feel lazy and overwhelmed sometimes
I have ADHD so sometimes offloading things to AI help me make sense of things when everything seems too much

It allows me to free up time to do other important things because it takes the thoughtless tasks off my hands and handles them quickly, more quicker than I could. I still have input when it comes to how I do my job.
Sometimes I feel as though I've lost control of things if I use AI too much.
I don't use AI, it's encouraging helplessness in the population
I think I get a bit overreliant on AI at times, and I think it is harming my early career slightly, as I am a little less competent than I would be if I was not using AI
It doesn’t. I use AI to quickly do what my brain can do over a longer spell.
I have yet to have any issues with them except for learning prompts and making it do as closely to as I like can be a bit of a hassle.

It can sometimes blur your way of thinking and you can get persuaded when maybe your gut is telling you other things. But you can come to rely on it and think it is making better choices than you are.
It makes me think better because it gives me ideas and advice that I wouldn't have otherwisde.

I use AI tools purely as tools, nothing else. They affect my ability to think and make decisions in the same way that computers and calculators do, basically not at all. The way I use these tools, they simply help me do things faster and more efficiently. Why would that have any effect on my ability to think clearly? Other than feeling tired from doing something for a long time which everything else also does, they have no negative impact on me.
It doesn’t really, I probably spend too much time using them but I don’t think it affects my cognitive abilities too much

I don't think that it affects my ability to think clearly, make decisions, or rest my mind. I am still very independent in my thoughts and tend to only use ai when i want to speed up the process of finding an answer to something i would otherwise google

AI tools help me figure out a potential root cause for something a lot better than my mind and or Google would ,and therefore it helps me make better decisions and rest my mind, as something that would take 45 min to identify the root cause via Google would take 2 min with AI
It can be difficult to feel like the decision is my own.

It is like I am working on autopilot and I feel like I am less human at times when relying on AI to assist me. It is easier and does help me out and saves time but I do wish it weren't as necessary in this modern world as I don't want to lose brain power.
I use it for harder tasks only or rewording my own never just because I can, I still do my own too as do not want to rely on it all the time!
I think the human mind needs to sit in silence and boredom to rest, and using digital/AI tools overstimulates the mind and detracts from the necessary silence.

I often find myself with brain fog after having used AI systems throughout the day, as it almost stops my brain from forming its own thoughts as I find myself automatically going to ChatGPT for a quick answer.
It doesn't
i think that i use Digital tools only when i need to so that helps me shorten the amount of time i have mental fatigue using these tools
It is no different to gaming, use it sparingly and for fun only, not to be taken seriously

column2: Unable to work due to illness or disability
column24: I think it affects my ability to think for myself sometimes
I do not really think AI effects my ability to thing. It allows me to access information quickly
I think using AI tools helps me think and gives me ideas which help me come to conclusions faster

Sometimes i'm cautious as i can read something on AI and question it's authenticy, i'm worried the responses are too generalised, a summary of information and therefore may not be accurate, i have concerns about misinformation and disinformation. I have read things that do not answer the question asked even though i consider it to be a simple one so i worry about the understaning of the question from the AI and if it's been answered accurately.
It gives me clarification in real wording on my thoughts
Sometimes I wonder if the judgements and conclusions are my own or if it is AI
Can cause you to be less inclined to search out information or learn on your own.
It takes away the drain from having to do repetitive tasks.
I think using AI can leave the user feeling detached rather quickly and has a negative effect on their cognitive abilities
Sometimes I feel like I need to get into the real world after using a computer for a long time. I like to take regular breaks and go for a walk or look at my garden to clear my mind and rest my eyes.
It is always just a lot of information to take in all at once.
No effect
It helps me overall, as I don't waste my time having to phrase communications to clients.
I feel like I lose some of my creativity and uniqueness when I use AI tools. It often "blocks" my ability to generate more individualized, unique decisions.

sometimes the answers you get are so perplexing, or seem tailored to want the "please you", you have to constantly check the work or fix mistake after mistake which takes even longer and is more taxing than not using it at all.
it provides me with useful information that is unique and personal which makes me feel at ease
I don’t feel it has anymore of a negative impact on any of those things any more than regular screen time. I always need breaks from the screen.
it can give me a lot of info to ponder about
Sometimes it is so much information that I feel mentally drained
I can think as clearly as always, when using AI, it doesn't affect me

It's distracting because you have spend more time trying to evaluate if you have been given factual information, and weighing up the option given to you by AI, it really just adds to your cognitive workload.
I think I view it as an advisory tool so I can recognise I do use it for decisions but I am not solely reliant on it. I might use it for mind clarity advise but not as a source
I feel reliant on it. It can start to stress me out like I'm losing my touch

It does sometimes feel that trying to distinguish from my original thought to the one presented by AI can be blurred. Sometimes the way things are reworded by AI makes me think, didn't I just say that, so makes me question my judgement or knowledge and then leads me down another rabbit hole of finding that out.

column2: Unable to work due to illness or disability
column24: I get lazy thinking and distracting or intrusive thoughts enter more in my head making me feel as though I need to rest to reset myself?

often when i am using AI tools, the amount of information it gives me is often large and cluttered so it takes more time to go through and analyze the results for accuracy. by having results and information generated it does save time initially, but having to comb through and check for accuracy is often draining as it feels like a menial task.
doesn't affect my ability to think clearly in any way
It doesn't affect my ability, because I use it sensibly and I rely on myself and my own thinking/creativity as much as possible. It's just there to help me if I'm lacking inspiration and so on.
It doesn't have a great deal of affect on me a I don't use AI tools often. I find them a pleasant diversion when I do use them as they are still a novel way of working to me.
It has no effect at all, I find it a useful tool and see it only as that
It really blurs things and ive to waste time validating the outputs

column2: Unable to work due to illness or disability
column24: I just use these tools to identify details so that I can make informed decisions, for instance about products and services. I do not offload decision-making authority at all.
I use AI every day only to confirm that the work I do is accurate.
I'm not sure it does very much personally. The only way I would suggest digital life affects my ability to concentrate is the sometimes constant buzz of notifications from my phone.
Whenever I ask AI something and it gives me the answer and I use the answer, even if I rephrase it I doubt if I truly understand it.
I use AI like a partner working together each providing information for a decision so no mental effect really

I think using AI affects my ability to make my own personal decisions as it does become easier to rely on AI to make decisions for me, leading to potential mistrust of myself, and lack of clear thinking. However, using AI does make it easier to rest my mind as the software does the bulk of the thinking for me.

I don't use AI programmes very often but I can definitely tell when I have been using screens too much and know I need to take a break and unwind. I think too much tech use is not something our brains are used to.
I end up relying on it too much and I think this can stifle my own thinking
Overload of words and information and very quickly spat out by the AI so i don't have time to think.
It can take away the human aspect of thinking, although I always try and go over its answers to check it/change it to be more human
i am reliant on Ai
At times it provides too much information to absorb, so I have to ask it to condense the information so that I am able to use the most relevant pieces and then research those on my own.
I can become too focussed on the interaction and less on my immediate surroundings

column2: Unable to work due to illness or disability
column24: It doesn't affect me negatively. Instead, since I can be mentally and physically fatigued due to medical issues, it helps me with tasks related to managing my medical stuff. For instance, I might give it the info that I want to convey during an upcoming appointment and then have it clarify and condense that to make it more effective. This saves me time and energy and makes me more likely to succeed at my appointment. This helps me to rest my mind by being more easily prepared.
I don't think using AI tools affects my decisions or thought clarity at all.

I don't think it has an effect on my mental abilities once the session is over. In-session, sometimes I can be a little too trusting of the AI. For example, I lost 2 hours at work the other day because ChatGPT hallucinated that something impossible to do with a Python library was possible. I assumed the AI was right and built scaffolding around the idea, only to realize the problem when I tried to slot the hallucination in.

So, while I find these LLMs to be useful tools, especially for remembering syntax in programming languages that I don't use often, I do catch myself believing them a little too readily. Once I step away though, I've synthesized anything true/useful it's said and moved on with my life. I don't think of it much differently than iterating on Google searches.
Using AI gives sometimes extensive options, sometimes helpful and sometimes obstructive.
I use it sometimes but don't want to become reliant on it
I think using AI tools helps me a lot but if I am giving it prompts and it's not following, that is stressful. I think a moment away from it helps declutter the mind quickly.
I focus too much on phrasing things correctly for AI rather than thinking however i want
The majority of decisions I make are made after some form of research using digital or AI tools. I don't feel self confident enough to make important decisions without using the internet now.
I don't use it a lot. So minimum impact.
Ai doesn't really affect my thinking in a deep way, I usually use AI as a support in my decisions. Sometimes it can help me to clearify some doubts but the final decision is always mine.
It just relies on something that isn't real to make the decision for us

USING DIGITAL AI TOOLS HELPS ME PROCESS INFORMATION FASTER AND STAY ORGANIZED, WHICH CAN MAKE DECISION MAKING FEEL MORE EFFICIENT. BUT SOMETIMES, RELYING ON THEM TOO MUCH MAKES IT HARDER TO TRUST MY OWN JUDGEMENT OR TAKE MENTAL BREAKS SINCE THERE'S ALWAYS MORE DATA TO ANALIZE OR NOTIFICATIONS TO CHECK
I think that sometimes I can get a bit carried away by delving deeper than I need to when using AI such as ChatGPT to help with queries.
It feels like my mind is atrophied when I don’t use it often to make my own decisions.

I honestly don't ever feel that I ca't think clearly or make my own decisions after using AI. I use Gemini daily, multiple times some days, buts its just a tool. Does a woodworker need time away from his saw to think clerly - i doubt it. Thats how I feel about using AI.
AI recommends suggestions and enables me to think and follow processes to achieve my goals and answers.
You start doubting your own judgement if you don't come up with the same as an AI
Makes things easier but sometimes I need a break
it definitely helps me to make better decisions when I have a choice to make
The only problems I experience are if I spend hours using the computer with no breaks. I have to get up, walk away and take breaks or else I feel fried.  I have no problems with AI

It informs me by offering a perspective rooted in a more objective analysis. I can tailor it's suggestions to suit me. I don't let it decide for me without thoroughly interrogated it to determine if it's accurate and trustworthy information.
AI improves all aspects and helps with decisions by finding helpful information. I can rest my mind while an AI it working on a solution giving me a break to think about other things
SOmetimes instead of fixing the error I kepp asking teh AI to fix teh error which drains all my energy
There's just so much of it going on
It makes systems and processes easier to deal with, and so reduces my own independent thought - I question if my own choices are the right ones and often feel the need to double check with AI
I just think it can make me feel more tired and just put me in a generally poor mood.
I use AI to mainly check information on certain medical topics. I read the answers and cross check on non AI platforms mainly to cover all bases and give me peace of mind
It has no current effect on me as my use is limited, when I do use it it has little effect on me.
i find I don't trust my own judgement or I a hard on myself when AI produces something better. I worry that I don't seem to be able to 'think through' problems any more
I think it’s the opposite it gives me clarity of thought and confirms why ideas are positive solutions
I use it like it is my partner in crime to tackle anything that is needed. The AI helps me but I make sure to review it with other sources before a decision
I don't use AI all that much, but when I do I use it as a supplement to what I already know. Sometimes I use it to summarize a long article, which helps me maintain focus.

Using AI can be very helpful for me in making decisions especially in regards to things like meal ideas. However, too much use leaves me scattered and overstimulated. It is imperative that i do not overuse AI and take regular breaks to calm my mind and think for myself.

Personally I think AI really helps me both personally  and in my business. I use it to ask advice on various topics, but also to create business emails, social media posts etc and I never really feel overwhelmed using it...

I find it very useful as a sounding board and information source, for example recently I asked chatgpt to help with diet and supplement plans. The knowledge it can provide saves me time and mental energy in working out what supplements interact with others, or with types of food, and the best plan overall for my health. This information helped me to think clearly and make decisions. It is not something that warranted a doctor's appointment but it made it much easier than timing supplements and counting calories by myself.

I think it's all to easy to become dependant on AI tools, so sometimes I feel that I have too many options with information whilst using it. Breaking away from it makes my head feel clearer, and like I am back in reality again.

I struggle to rest as im having to use my eyes for screen interaction then my mind and voice when using voice prompts to generate responses and that can take a mental toll over time and leave me feeling reliant on the technology making me uneasy
Sometimes, there is a bit of a reliance on AI tools that encourages mental laziness, which results in less time to think clearly on your own.
It doesn’t? I find that I can think quite clearly regardless
I use AI tools to gather information and not for it to make decisions for me.  While I depend on AI to help me with my work, I do not let it control me.
you concentrate so hard on the prompt sometimes you loses focus on exactly what you were asking. your mind gets muddled.
It helps me to think more clearly by helping when my mind is blocked. It gets my creative side going again.
It doesn't affect my ability to think clearly. They're a tool that I can use to help refine my work.
It’s very convenient but often makes me feel guilty when it makes decisions I can not override.
I don't want to feel like AI is in control of my life.

It saves me time initially but then later it causes me more challenges when I need to analyse the answers or double/triple check to be sure what I am being told is correct. Over time this can become more taxing and leads me to question more than without using AI tools.
it helps with the advice I need to give but when I'm not 100% sure my advice is correct
I use them as a tool only. If I don't like the answers it gives then I'm perfectly happy to use my own judgement instead. I'm not really conflicted with the use of AI tools.

They really don't. I use AI tools to get information and sometimes it gets things wrong.  So my mind is clear and correct even though the AI isn't.  I use it to get the information that I want and correct it when it is wrong.
It doesnt mess with my ability to make decisions, but it does help me with making more informed decisions.
AI has not affected my ability to make decisions or think clearly
usually it is used to re-enforce something I think I know the answer / what to do. it also helps with ideas and sometime helps put my thoughts into words
It makes it a bit easier se we don’t have
Ai can boost efficiency but can clutter my thinking and drain focus
AI tools can sometimes give me a headache because I do not trust the output and I am constantly fact-checking.

Prior to putting anything into AI you have some kind of understanding what the answer will be as its a thought process. However when AI puts a different outcome all together then it makes it simpler and clearer and thinks of different avenues you havent.
I think it can make it tough to see what was your decision and what the AI coaxes you to do. Also, it can be tiring to constantly fact check which affects my ability to think clearly
digital language based tools tend to drain me after long periods of time whereas visual aI tool tend to stimulate and excite me most of the tme

It can at times be overwhelming as I'm presented with such a large volume of information when the intention was seeking support in decision making. But on the flip side, it can really help me in prioritising some things, especially in terms of asking it to review large documents or series of documents to identify the most relevant sections. I have found that mastering prompt engineering has really helped avoid the more negative side of it and have much more positive interactions
I’m never 100% confident it’s the right thing and can often not sound like me so everyone would know it’s AI
It makes me more indecisive and not trust my own judgement
Using AI tools makes me think less hard on topics. I turn to AI instead of thinking deeply on things.
I feel like it is the opposite- AI let's me have a small brain break in between thinking, to automate things that aren't needing my own personal input.

I see AI tools as just another source of information and data that I can use to inform some of my decision-making. Ultimately the decisions I make are still mine, and I feel that I think just as clearly as ever.

column2: Unemployed and not currently looking for work
column24: I think they rest my mind by helping me conclude information on topics, allowing me to free my mind from the worries of certain things.
I sometimes feel I rely to heavily on AI. I can tend to get engaged with it and then lose track of time because I'm enjoying myself. Then I end up feeling guilty for all the time I spent with it.

column2: Unable to work due to illness or disability
column24: I think using AI makes decisions really easy for me. So when I do use AI tools, I feel as I don't think clearly or at my best because I am relying so much on the AI tool instead of my own thoughts.
I have a very good relationship with AI in my work ive had no issues and our company provides training for all staff
sometimes i can have thoughts replaying in my mind after work with certain inputs i have made throughout the day. i generally am able to switch my mind away from it quite esy though
It helps me break down complex topics and creates structure in order to better reinforce understanding

column2: Unable to work due to illness or disability
column24: It doesn't really _ I use it for programming, so can test the results and adjust without too much thought.
I may become overly reliant on them and so I would end up being unable to make independent judgement especially if the AI is incorrect.

It makes me question my own judgement and my own ability to collate information effectively. I often end up worrying about whether the ai information is correct and if I should check it all myself rather than take it all as gospel
I feel like it allows me to rest my mind. Normally for me, I just use AI to revise things, so I can confidently say they are at least my own thoughts.
It makes you forget how to think for yourself
It's hard to unblur the lines between where I end and where AI starts. I sometimes "hallucinate" and think that my words were made by the AI and vice versa.

I do not think using digital or AI tools hinders my ability to make decisions or think clearly. However, it can make it more difficult to rest my mind afterwards, because of the large input of new information that usually comes with how I use these tools.
It doesn’t affect it much
using AI helps me in making decisions as it is useful for many things but it does not clutter my mind or causes any negative effects

I don’t think it really affects my ability to think. I still have my own thoughts and am easily able to seperate my own thoughts from AI and/or think without AI. However it does make decision making easier sometimes. And I feel like it puts me at ease instead of questioning if I’m making the right decision

It doesn’t. I use it as a tool to help me, i do no rely on it, i can live without it and function perfectly efficiently and competently. AI has no negative impact on my life and does not stop me from being able to make decisions, think clearly or rest.
I think I get used to AI answering all my questions and making the decisions that lose trust in myself to do these things,
It does not affect my cognative abilities

I believe that I'm getting lazier and lazier as I'm relying on AI more to help me make decisions without using my own mind. I sometimes feel like I can't think for myself and think this is due to me using AI more and more. I need a rest for AI at periodic intervals to go through my thoughts and think more clear, original ideas

I don't think AI affects my ability to think clearly, etc. But actually I'm getting a bit tired of AI, especially AI answering every question, etc., I put in Google search. AI is getting tiresome because it's everywhere--not just in Google search and AI chatbots but in the news, in people's writing/posts in discussion forums and Blogs, in jobs new and disappearing, in everyone's conversation, and just appearing everywhere. I'd like a day when I don't have to hear about, see, or read about AI---like not forever, but just not everywhere, every day.

I would say that making a difficult strategic decision at work is easier with the guidance of AI and sometimes it can affect my ability when I don't have access to AI to help me. I don't think I use it often enough for it to make me feel like I can't switch off from it (luckily!)
I feel it has no impact, I use AI as an aid but don’t depend on it
Makes me know that ive got a wealth of knowledge that i havent learnt yet.
I feel dependence of AI opinion and checking if I am wrong or right all of the time
Helps me but doesn't feel natural
It sometimes overloads me with information which I feel I need to sift through for the truth.
I try stay away, Best I can, it's overload and contradictory , sometimes fun, but only fir a short period, I'm 60, I don't need this
it helps me to think swiftly  making it align with my own personal thoughts in achieving my goals which can somehow reduce mental stress for me like  overthinking.

I think it mainly comes under the heading 'TMI' or 'information overload'. AI responses often try to be all things to all people in a single response. It would be easier to assimilate information or guide the AI in the direction I want to go, if conversations started with brief introductions to ideas and themes and allow me to choose which to develop and in what order. The lack of sources or references/credits is enormously frustrating and in general I am uncomfortable with the way AI adopts and presents ideas as their own rather than the scientist or professional who is really responsibly. Sometimes the length of responses is off-putting and written in styles that are not easily accessible ie need to read a few times to ger the sense of the comments due to unusual vocabularly or sentence structure. All this is like 'noise' over and above the analysis and decision I am trying to progress.
take shortcuts and be more efficient

While ai can help in certain situations i find it dives too in depth for my work in college and is not exactly the information i am looking for so i often find myself conflicted between my own thoughts and what ai is telling me.
I feel like I automatically reach for AI tools rather than defaulting to my own brain power and it scares me

I'm not dependent on AI. Occasionally I'll use it for quick answers if I'm too lazy to research something or make a decision myself. I see AI as a way to minimize thinking instead of constantly worrying about how to use AI. Since I have always been skeptical of AI and it's overall helpfulness, I'm more likely to doubt any results I get rather than to trust them blindly.

There's no end to the amount of information available. So I find myself delving deeper and deeper, looking for the perfect answer/response. I'm never satisfied with it's first response and find myself fine tuning my prompts to influence the responses then on.

It can sometimes make things too complex, but it can also simplify and give information at a glance. If I don't trust what it is saying then I cross reference with another source. Regarding input, it can be a time waster giving it varied instructions in order to achieve a good outcome.
Constantly thinking about problems and their solutions can be taxing

It generally helps me to make decisions, especially when needing to compare things or decide the most suitable product or course of action. I feel I can think clearly with or without AI tools.
I do find the amount of information and text from AI tools slightly overloading sometimes, so if I used it too much I would definitely need a break from it.
it doesn't affect my ability, it helps it, it makes things easier to process and draft things, so effectively it helps rest my mind sooner than if i did not use AI tools
Using AI tools helps me solve problems which puts me at east. However, i feel like I'm becoming dependent on it which makes me uneasy.
I don't feel it does, I only use it sometimes and when I do, it is me that feeds the info. to AI in the first place then I myself decide which piece of info. it provides I will use

i make a point if not being reliant on AI and i wont be using it for advice, i use it for information only, i find it interesting that i now see ads for chatgbt on regular tv making it seem like we need it to make what seems like logical action that can be decided ourselves, i appreciate how  good it is for knowledge like planning a trip but not for asking how i should feel or act in situations, its a fine line between Ai being helpful and making life easier and overly ridiculously and scarily intrusive
Sometimes I get caught up in the information provided by AI

Algorithms basically deciding and recommending videos on YouTube and same with Netflix! Showing you content that you may like going off previously watched series and films. Sometimes it can have you in a bubble in which you basically watch content YouTube recommends.
I find my self relying on it like it’s my work when it’s really not..
It can affect me sometimes but I take breaks for my mental health

I have to repeat the thought in order to communicate it to my AI tool. Once I receive feedback from it, I have to assess the response and then ask it follow-up questions. Although it's designed to help, there's still a lot of work involved in using AI output.
It makes things clearer and eases my mind knowing I don’t need to worry about it.

Occasionally, I have felt overwhelmed by the amount of information, and the elaborateness of conceptual or thematic schemes, with which AI tools can supply me. Sometimes I have felt a sense of disconnect and insignificance, when confronted with an extensive account of an academic debate, for example, so that I wonder what I have left to contribute: should I follow a lonely, limited path of my own - or attempt to follow the many routes suggested by AI.

Whether good or bad, using AI tools often expands the boundaries of the original human thought.  This can be a good thing in certain situation as viewing things from every possible angles are import.  But at the same time, it may expand your thought beyond the necessary boundaries without realizing it, which can affect the results of whatever you are working on in a negative way.
I feel as if I am not competent enough and gradually loosing my confidence.  Though it helps to deliver efficient and effective results, it is also making me loose self confidence.

I think it makes me less likely to make a fully focussed effort to find the information I want, as I know AI can do so instantly, saving me time. This is very useful but does not stimulate or engage my brain. I worry it could lead to cognitive decline in future.
It doesn’t affect my ability to think clearly. I use it and then move on.
AI helps a ton with repetitive tasks, which gives me more time to think clearly.
I sometimes question whether the information that AI provides is up to date and correct. That’s why I like to save posts about certain things and add to them when I know more.
When using AI because of the amount of information I receive it sometimes makes me feel overwhelmed when all I wanted was a simple answer to my question
I can always think clearly, I tend to use AI purely for information gathering and solutions to research and general enquiries
It helps me to reach the right conclusions or results by usually re-enforcing what I already believed, bringing me relief and confidence and usually saving me time.

column2: Unable to work due to illness or disability
column24: It doesn't affect me due to my not using it.
I dont use AI tools so hopefully I think clearly most of the time
there's a feeling of always being connected, that you can never be alone with your thoughts unless you're silent
Using digital or AI tools can help me to make some decisions and get ideas more quickly and clearly.

I have a strategic way of thinking problems through. If AI provides the answer sometimes I don't understand how the answer was reached and it can make me question the answer, so my mind won't rest. I cannot just accept an answer, I need to understand how the answer is reached.

If I do it too much, I start to worry about cognitive decline, especially since dementia runs in the family lol. I suppose if I used it for creative answers, it might start to blur and I'd question if I'd come up with it or AI.

The amount of information presented is sometimes overwhelming so it's hard to reach a decision as to the way forward. Often there are no sources mentioned to support the ideas presented which gives a level of uncertainty as to the reliability of the tool.
I find myself second guessing my decisions as I've become somewhat reliant on AI to assist my decision making. The longer I spend away from AI the better my decision making becomes.
it does not affect me like this
I think it makes me question my own judgements and thought processes, and I doubt my own abilities

it makes me feel stimulated because it is so quick and easy to use but it does not interfere with my ability to work or think on my own. I use AI as an assistant and partner so it helps me more than hurts me.
I often feels as if it clouds my judgement and coming back to what's real takes me some time.
it is something i use to give me a insight which i may not have thought of but in the end i make my own mind up

column2: Unemployed and not currently looking for work
column24: i only use ai infrequently, and mainly to generate images such as birthday cards for friends.  In this context, I find it helpful as it quickly gets the task done for me, so it actually is more restful for me than having to create the cards manually.  In terms of other interactions with ai, I mostly come across these when doing surveys for Prolific.  Here, I do find the conversations mentally taxing, and it can be quite difficult steering the AI in the direction you want, as well as mentally demanding trying to assess its accuracy
It is just frustrating
It helps me say what I want to say in a more coherent way

column2: Self-employed / freelance but also looking for work
column24: Excessive use of digital or AI tools can lead to it becoming a habit where you simply use the digital or AI tools to make decisions for you and you end up not thinking at all.
It makes it harder for me to figure things out on my own.

I think AI is just a tool that helps me get to solutions and answers faster. I will say that now that I have it in my pocket, I will often rely on it do to the thinking for me, instead of coming to conclusions myself.

I have only used Ai a few times because it makes me feel like I cannot think for myself and takes away my critical thinking skills. The few times I used it I felt unsure if I was truly making decisions myself and it confused me more than if I had put the effort in to make a decision without it.

I find that using AI tools helps streamline tasks that are mundane or tasks that feel so large that I'm not sure where to start. However, I feel at unease when tasks are fully done by AI because it makes me worry about my own critical thinking abilities
I need to be on guard for wrong information frequently. I feel that I'm actually training it sometimes and it's taxing.
They can overload me with information which I cannot be sure is true or contradict my own knowledge, which is confusing.

column2: Unable to work due to illness or disability
column24: It becomes too easy to start using the digital or AI tools more and more to get more ideas, rather than stop and think for myself.
I think using AI tools can affect my ability to think critically and be quite lazy.
I think it feels like it add clutter. It's hard to pick a part AI results into something refined.
I worry I have an over reliance on AI tools, and that I will be slower or more likely to overthink simply decisions in the future.
Sometimes I can see things that I don't want to think about, and even when I ask AI tools questions that I can actually solve, I dull my brain by not letting it work.
It takes the pressure of a decision away although I dont want to rely on it.
Using for every small decision will make my mind think I should stop over using it, use it only necessary and my mind will not make right decisions.

I find AI very useful for certain tedious tasks such as analyzing large data sets and making sense of a large amount of data.  AI does not hinder my abilities regarding decision making or clear thinking
it does not affect it at all
My mental ability is certainly negatively affected because I don't have to use my brain much when using AI tools. They do the work for me.

I only use AI when I really can’t make the decision myself and need some guidance or extra support. I use my own mind first and 2nd AI. So AI doesn’t affect my ability to think clearly, make decisions or rest my mind

Using AI can help me think clearer most of the time because it organizes my thoughts and I have ADHD so its normally hard to do this and it also breaks things down for me. However, if i use it too much or too long my brain shuts off as if I am relying on it too much. I think it makes the decision making process a bit easier but i definitely need my breaks from it to reset myself.

It makes me think less critically and less able to think for myself so I feel very uneasy about using it and the implications of others using it. I feel that people will lose the ability to research, write well and think for themselves. They will also lose the ability to spend a lot of time working on things and thinking about ideas. They may also not trust their own ideas without checking with AI. I feel overwhelmed when using technology.

Using digital and AI tools helps me get things done, but they can leave my mind feeling a bit cluttered if I use them too long. I still rely mostly on my own judgment, and I need regular breaks from screens to think clearly and reset.
I think it just improves on my thinking process and improves how I function.

Although using AI can be helpful, I find I am clarifying the information given quite often. Sometimes I just bypass AI and just search or go about my task without AI. This way I start off searching credible sites. I do think AI seems to be getting better, but I still find sometimes I an better off doing projects or searches on my own.
I work ai tools just create a feedback loop and encourage what you were already thinking instead of helping one to use critical thinking skills
It makes me wonder how I can go about confirming the AI results. Sometimes there is no immediate way to do so and I'm left with doubt about the usability of the results.

Most of my interactions are with the AI summaries that my browser supplies when I do a search. I find that it's easy to rely on those summaries when I know that they are frequently less than accurate. Something about the presentation gives them a sort of authority. I have to force myself to check them. I worry about the implications for decision making.
I don't use AI for anything except when it is foisted upon me

I think generally spending too much time on screens clutters your brain and because of the stimulation, when you leave it, there is always some time afterwards where you think you should go back to get this done or look up that or check email.

I don't tend to have any issue with thinking clearly, making decisions or having a restful mind with AI use but I tend to prefer to not be over reliant on AI as I don't trust it 100% & think it is better to have human input without too much AI.
Sometimes I’m just looking for objectivity and AI can provide that when I’m too caught up in my own head.
It is good to get fairly reliable information from from AI on lots of issues. One does not hsve to work out everything oneself so can get on with tasks faster
I only use them minimally and I don't find they impact my ability to make decisions
I think using AI tools is almost lazy, when I've used AI, I'm basically using AI to do the thinking for me. I'm not convinced this is a good thing overall for the human race.

I usually do not use AI UNLESS a mini-job I do for a company or so require it. This said, AI tools are not my thinking, and I rely om ,y own decisions instead of a system. In this case, it does not affect me to think clearly, to make decisions on my own, or to rest my mind.
AI helps me consider pitfalls and alternatives when it comes to making decisions and critical thinking.
I think it enables me to think and look at a problem from a different POV. However there can be times where info provided can be overwhelming
I think it makes me reliant on it and damages my critical thinking skills
I think it fills my head with useless information and makes it harder to focus. I find it harder to sleep after using digital technology.
The tools take my mind off in a different direction and make me think of questions I didn’t necessarily intend to ask
I don't really use AI in that way. I get it to make up poems, or suggest songs to go with my instagram posts. It's not making decisions for me

The only issue I have with AI in how it affects me mentally is that I feel it makes me lazier and dumber in some ways. Like instead of remembering stuff on my own, I might ask an AI with very little information and it always figures out what I was trying to remember. So, I have kind of stopped myself from immediately relying on that unless I really cannot remember the name of something after a while. It's all about balance I guess. It has improved my writing, though.
i am not good at making decisions so they help me, not hinder

AI is good for certain tasks, but it can provide too many options, incorrect or irrelevant information. It seems to be taking away my own creativity and imagination. It is so easy and convenient, I do feel tempted and that is why i force myself to stop at times, to detach.
It makes it easier to make decisions
You become more reliant on these tools and often become lazy and use common sense. It is easier to just use AI tools as opposed to thinking hard

It doesn't. It is possible that if I used them more than I do, it could affect my ability to think clearly, but I only occasionally use them and I do not feel any effect on my ability to think or make decisions.
It consumes me sometimes to the point where it can become addictive.

column2: Unpaid full-time carer fo non-family member
column24: I sometime get annoyed when ChatGPT fails to follow instruction which can leave me feeling stressed out for a while.  I tend to go away and calm down and then rather get back involved in a prompt tussle again, interrogate it for why it is behaving the way it is and how to avoid unwanted outcomes, which has been very successful.  I don't believe AI particularly affects my ability to think clearly or make decisions at all.

When I use digital tools too often, I feel like my mind becomes dependent on them to make even the most basic of decisions, so I have to step back and use my brain as it is intended to get myself re-focused again.
It sometimes makes me doubt myself, although it can definitely help make interesting and useful suggestions.
Sometimes makes you question your own judgement
It is mentally taxing to use something that is a simulacrum of the human mind, a little redundant and awkward.
It makes me feel a little less competent when I need to use AI.
I don't think it has any negative impact on my ability to think clearly, make decisions, or rest my mind. I think it is a tool to come up with more ideas to help me make a more informed decision

I think it's good if it's on way. And it really makes the decision for you if you really think about it you ask a question and it give you an answer to this pretty much put anybody in between accepted and you lose sense of self
i dont think it affects my thinking at all, merely enables efficiency in the minutae of work
I think it helps me consider new options in the decision making process, or reinforce how I feel about the options. Its more an assistant than a driver in thinking and making decisions .

Using AI tools seems to have an affect where it drags me into a rabbit hole if that's a good way to put it. It seems to capture my mind and make me want to keep engaging and keep generating more from more prompts. I think it helps me learn more about the world but I find that I start to overly rely on it and if I try not to use it, I find that I feel less confident about my own decision making ability.
Sometimes it help to not overthinking. If I suggest AI to be brutally honest and get to the point, it is easier for me.
I think it doesn't let me think as critically as I should. I think there's a lot of information, so it's gets a bit draining. I do need a break after using AI tools every once in a while.
Using digital tools is merely a supplement to my own thoughts. I am always in control and don't have a burnout problem.
I think ai tools have advanced so much that they are very persuasive

I sometimes use AI to write emails or work for me when I've hit a block, I'll ask it to add empathy or soften what I've said. I usually use it to edit rather than to create. I find that it makes me feel like i'm getting more stupid and less able to think for myself - i feel lazy when I use it because I'm quite capable of doing the tasks i'm asking it to do
They don't. I have only used AI on my own twice, and even though, I asked a simple question, AI answered it, and I was done.
I feel like sometimes I cannot think for myself depending on the context. But it has helped me at times.
Using AI makes me over think the outcome, whether its correct and whether I should be using it as part of day today life

It allows me to think about the issue i’m trying to fix and the grammar and spelling and structure can be done by AI. That way i don’t have to worry about anything other than the thing i’m trying to figure out.

Using AI doesn't affect me much in life as I try to avoid using it as much as possible. I sometimes use it when writing greetings cards / messages, which can make me feel like the message hasn't really come from me.
I think it can be a bit overwhelming at times using all these tools and yes your mind can feel a little overstimulated afterwards
It makes me think more to try and refine an output that i want the ai to produce but relying on everday decisions for ai make me feel reliant and incapable of thinking
I am worried about ai, and I don’t trust it

I am one of those people who are always thinking. I like using my mind. I compose essays about things in my head.  AI doesn't bother me as an idea generator, but it stresses me if it suggests points, arguments, etc. for an idea that is mine. I also dislike suggestions for making choices unless I specifically ASK for that. It's unsettling, confusing and also in some way feels like cheating.
i use it in work to help with stock control honestly it help me well
It doesn’t change
I'm only using AI tools on an irregular basis, but daily. So far, I haven't found it affects my ability to think clearly or make decisions.
It sometimes impairs my thinking as I look to AI to help me clarify a decision I've made`

its a tool, an aid - its not a replacement for my human brain. its there to help (like any other tool) the tone of the question implies some kind of 'grip' or addiction which is hard to 'wean' yourself off of
AI tools are useful in my day-to-day activities, like paraphrasing and generating inage
Using digital or AI tools can sometimes make it harder to think clearly and relax, as they often leave my mind busy and overactive.
It helps me to summarise potential negative outcomes of a decision and have a list of pros and cons to consider, in order to make a faster decision without a lot of research.
Get answers without really thinking about it.

I have to use AI tools for work occasionally (several times a week as a freelancer), and I find having to interface with them to be frustrating and redundant most of the time. I wouldn't interact with them if I could avoid doing so, as I'm highly computer-literate and prefer normal digital tools and software that I am in full control of (like running batch scripts).

If focuses your mind on the initial choices to be  made.

;
I haven't experienced any problems using digital or AI tools
Using AI feels like not fully utilising my own abilities which in turn diminish

I tend to dive deeper when AI keeps makeing more suggestions or offering more ways to help. I want to just get an answer sometimes and not keep going when they ask if I constantly want more help (ChatGPT )

These tools can be helpful but I increasingly feel like they are too much, and I want to step away from using them. But I can't, I need them for my work. Everything feels too "noisy" when I use these tools - too many distractions, hard to keep focus. The modern world feels so busy and overstimulating. When I'm able to step away, I feel my brain "relaxing" and "breathing". I always feel so much better, much healthier.

AI is a tool that gives good solid additional information that helps me make a good decision. It also helps in most cases confirm my decision by giving supporting information. It also gives suggestions that I may have not thought of. It is a great tool for me. It is a search engine on steroids.

Though I use AI agents frequently, I consciously choose to remember that these are tools that are helping me. They are not making decisions for me. I believe in "Augmented Intelligence" - I am using AI to augment my own intelligence. I do not rely on AI solely, especially not for decisions. Digital tools and screen use is another matter. I spend most days working at my laptop and when I'm not on my laptop I'm on my cellphone reading news or using apps. If I get a day or a few hours when I'm out doing something that prevents me from using my phone, I appreciate it and my mind feels more rested, but I'm not conscious for the most part of my mind being fatigued by my constant screen use at other times.
Often use AI to check my understanding of topics by including phrases like "UK law". Whether agrees or disagrees with me, helps me make decisions or decide to research further.
It allows me to sort of rest my mind, but I feel it's hard to get back into my rythym iff I spend too much time with AI
Sometimes it makes me lazy and take shortcuts when I know it shouldn't, but it does make things easier and more efficient in my mind.
I do not use AI tools specifically because I think it would undermine my ability to think and make decisions and do things for myself

Using AI tools helps me make decisions and see things clearly. I don't have a need to 'rest my mind' because of using AI tools. AI tools helps me see things and find solutions to things much more quickly and from various 'perspectives' than I could ever glean myself and or with others within a quick timeframe.
It helps me think more clearly and make decisions more easily by rationalizing my thoughts and providing me with other perspectives or inspiration, that I may have not previously considered.

It allows me to bounce around ideas with the AI and ultimately helps me form a conclusion or better understanding of something. I can ask any questions i may have no matter how poor they are and put my mind at ease by finding things out quickly.
I try not to use AI tools too often, because I feel like it cripples my ability to be creative and too much use can feel like a crutch.
We depend more and more on AI and loosing our creativity and mental work

I sometimes may use AI to give overview or important points on a topic I am researching or writing about- especially if I have writer’s block. But sometimes I am asked to use AI for a task and it bothers me that I am required to consider or use AI suggestions…
It doesn't really help me to do any of those things - I mainly use it to find information or for it to create things

I only use AI search tools to get a quick summary about a subject I know little about. For me, it's just a means of getting started on researching something. I purposely avoid getting sucked into the world of AI because it is draining and not very productive. Keeping it's use to a minimum helps me to get the best out of it without feeling cluttered

I think using ai prevents you from using your own brain to come up with solutions to problems. AI will just parrot back to you what you want to hear, not necessarily what you need to hear, and that can be confusing

I find myself getting annoyed with the AI when it makes mistakes or misunderstands me, this clutters up my head with distracting thoughts. I would rather I was able to take the time to think things through slowly, but due to time pressures this would be difficult to get back to.

I feel like AI has been mostly positive when it comes to helping me think and make decisions. I haven't noticed any negative impact. I am a little concerned with long term decision making though - I'm afraid that relying on AI will make me feel like I can't trust my own judgments.
I would say it can be helpful for me to make a more informed decision, but don't feel like it has a strong effect on how I think or my ability to rest my mind.

I feel that AI tools like LLMs help to surface information and information-leads that I can follow, and organizes it into a structured way that's easier for me to digest than doing broad research from scratch. This can make me feel more confident to come to a conclusion or decision, which is mentally positive. Other AI tools such as image/video/music generation, help me to relax in a manner similar to listening to music or other creative endeavours.
It makes me lazy to think for myself occasionally
I find AI a great help and reinforces my own decisions
I don't use digital tools or AI precisely because I don't want to lose the ability to think for myself - to rely so much on AI doesn't feel like progress for humanity at all .

Using AI tools both helps and hinders me.  AI can help free up my mind by doing a lot of leg work and analysis for me.  On the other hand, sometimes I can find myself overrelying on AI without using enough of my own reasoning.  Therefore, AI can help free up some mental capacity for me to think, but it can hinder my decision making process if I rely on it too often.
I feel like using AI tools helps me to distill things down better to allow for me to actually think clearly. I can offload some simple decisions or tasks and then I can focus on what's needed.

I sometimes find it hard to switch off from using digital devices. But when I am able to stay away from them for a good period of time, my mind feels calmer and I am able to concentrate on something else. However, I will be inevidentally drawn back,  as some things that I do rely on digital devices
I don't go out of my way to use AI and can't use it at work. But sometimes I'm forced to when interacting with a company and I hate it. I end up getting so frustrated that I want to scream.
I find using Ai really saves me a lot of time. However, sometimes I think I am becoming more stupid because I am relying on it too much and I worry I will not be able to think for myself.

I do not feel it affects my ability to think clearly, make decisions or rest my mind. I am in complete control of when I use it. I only use it for advice, if it conflicts with what I thought I do further research to avoid misinformation but other than that I am in complete control of the situation

I try to minimize my use of AI, saving it for work tasks. I am afraid of using it for writing, as I don't want to lose my creativity and my unique voice. I only use it for unimportant tasks and decisions because I have found it to be highly inaccurate and shallow.
I use mostly for work purposes, so I’ll say it most times makes me make decisions without thorough thinking, it also me unable to fully rest my mind as I switch between tasks.

I don't use AI a lot at present. However I do use digital tools everyday.  I find that I can get pulled down different rabbit holes and need a clear purpose and time frame to remain clear and focused. My mind looks for the distraction of digital tools. I worry about that. However when I am working creatively or writing something- it is still my work. I don't use AI to help me draft at present.

column2: Unable to work due to illness or disability
column24: It helps to reassure me that I am thinking along the right track.
AI helps me get answers very quickly and many times the answers are a summary so I do not need to read pages of information. It helps me think about other things in life that are important
It does not affect my ability to make decisions or think clearly.
It does not. AI is simply a tool, like all the other that I already use. It does not have that effect on me at all.
it provides me with inspiration to expand on y own ideas at work
Sometimes the AI gives such long winded information it can take time to digest it all and take in.

I usually find digital/AI tools useful in helping to cut down on the volume of information I need to use for my decisions and this is less overwhelming for me. However, I then tend to use them to make more decisions so it can be mentally taxing after a while.

Using AI helps clear my thought process to make decisions by quickly but thoroughly analysing the pros and cons of each outcome. This can rest my mind by ensuring all outcomes are explored but can sometimes be overwhelming due to the volume of information
I feel a large sense of guilt when I use AI - like I am cheating

I appreciate being able to use digital/AI tools to easy my workflows and help to save time on  less important tasks (ie. rewording) that would otherwise take longer. Sometimes, the process of writing out information or a prompt to ChatGPT is a helpful experience for me to articulate my thoughts in a clear way.

using AI can make me distrust its results. If I don't like the decision made by AI, I will look for reasons why the AI is not correct and/or try to change the outcome. I don't trust AI enough to always trust its output, so it can end up taking me even longer to do things rather than save me time.
I don't use AI tools enough for that to be a problem. I used more AI tools like generative fill in Photoshop instead of chat bots

i think ai tools has helped me as i tend to use it as a second opinion and whether to see what it thinks of my own decision, i don't think it has hindered my own ability to think clearly or make decisions.
I maybe become dependant on it about taking decisions or writing properly and makes my brain a bit lazy

Using digital tools makes me to think and evaluate situations in an in-depth manner with different sources, materials, and methodologies. My procedures for verification are also iterative to get the best result.
I don't use AI tools to help me make decisions, I mostly use it to learn
