When you use AI tools to help you on a task it loses your own creativity cause you rely on AI too much when you're doing work
Using AI tools make me feel like I don't think critically about things and it makes me feel like I took the easy way out to create something.
i worry about AI and its effects on the human race in the future sp after using sometimes the worries come back
sometimes draining to figure out if the response can actually be trusted
I try not to use AI tools as I am concerned that it will negatively impact m,y ability to think and do independently
I only use ai for entertainment purposes.

I find using AI tools very convenient because they allows me to get the information and ideas I want while saving time. Even if the AI tool gives me various advice, I will make decisions after thinking about it myself and will not rely solely on the AI tool. For example, when I ask the AI tool for advice on self-care, it gives me a variety of useful information, which is very helpful in maintaining peace of mind. I think the type of text that users input into the AI tool is also an important key to reaping the benefits of using AI tools.
It's a lot of information to process at once. Usually you have to look up the different topics, but with AI it will just spit everything out all at one time
i feel AI doesn't have a significant impact on my mind
I don't use AI often enough to be overly affected by it mentally or for it to affect my decision making in my opinion.
I am able to think clearly in most cases but when thinking of situations im not the most confident in I tend to second guess myself and let AI assist me / make a decision for me.

Using AI helps me make plans for holidays or work out medical ailments much quicker than googling for research. So it really helps me make decisions quickly and often helps me be more logical in my thinking too.
it doesnt i find it helps with clarity
I Honestly really don't think it does affect me at all
Using AI can affect one’s ability to make normal simple quick every day decisions if they start to solely rely on AI for everything. It can make you think less because you can depend on AI more.
It helps me to make decisions and do my job, but it doesn't affect my ability to think clearly because my mind is sharp no matter what due to how it naturally works & analyzes.
I hardly ever use AI but when I do,I just do not like how I feel using AI suggestions.  It just does not feel normal or right
I don’t use AI tools at all
AI has made me question everything I see online and I don’t trust anything it says
it makes me feel heavily reliant on it and not think clearly because I am so heavily reliant on it

I actually feel it increases my ability to make decisions and rest my mind because I don't  have to think as hard.  For instance I don't have to think of the details as much but can concentrate on the overall big picture.

IT certainly simplifies my life since I can save time and get answers to questions that I did not know. Perhaps relying on it too much can reduce critical thinking skills, but AI has definitely helped me in my work life.
It makes me think of decisions quicker but it doesn't feel as authentic
It makes me feel less confident with making decisions on my own. I would rather use my cognitive skills to stay sharp, and not be too reliant on AI.
Sometimes I get a thought and get distracted talking to the AI about it instead of doing more productive things.
It does not

I can think clearly even when using AI tools. Even when against a tough question, I'll read what the AI says after my prompt and try to see how it got there, though it is mentally taxing to review. It is also taxing for me to stare at  screen when using my phone for AI, as my eyes are sensitive and over long periods of screen use I get brain fog.
It doesn't affect it that much. But my eyes too get tired of screens.
Sometimes after using AI tools, I feel less confident in my own capability to solve the issue as AI has provided the answers.
AI is helpful and frees me up to focus on important things.

column2: Unable to work due to illness or disability
column24: Using AI makes me feel lazy and less likely to think when I need to make complex decisions.
I overall get frustrated by a lot of digital/AI tools being unreliable, and limit my use of them.
Using AI helps with important decisions it don’t make me think not clearly
I do sometimes think that using AI tools too much detracts from my ability/willingness to make my own independent decisions, which is slightly concerning to me.

I find I increasingly ask and act on advice from AI tools. Im obviously not using my own ability to research/make decisions when I do this. I guess I do worry a little that Im becoming a bit dependant on AI. I would not say it puts my mind at unrest exactly but I do get a bit too involved sometimes.

I think if you rely on  AI tools too much, then it may stifle you're ability to think critically, I feel if you exercise you're mind in this area, you will be more assertive and higher functioning in general .I think AI although very useful can be damaging to young people, when they are developing those critical thinking and problem solving muscles.
I don't like to use AI tools because I feel they diminish my ability to think and be creative on my own.

I do not think that using digital or AI tools significantly impact my ability to think clearly or make decisions as I generally use AI as a 'backstop' to ensure that my decision or information is correct in a speedy and less taxing manner. However, I do think that it impacts my ability to fully rest my mind. I feel not entirely able to disconnect from digital systems and work for longer than I intended to as digital systems make things much easier to just keep going. Thinking about what I need to do and how I am going to do it is something that I have noticed more and more with increasing digital use and this impacts on my ability to rest my mind.
I think AI tools have a positive effect on my abilities because they help me catch things I might not have thought of. In this way they enhance what I could do on my own.

It's like a bicycle for the mind; in its absence I can attain the same result but it helps me reach a decision quicker and gives me more clarity since my decision making is largely knowledge dependent.
Sometimes my mind feels convoluted after work and I need a break from screens
I use AI tools to suggest options that I havent thought of, especially when travelling to places I have not been to before.
if I have a problem digitally I can count on AI

Sometimes AI feels like too much of a shortcut, like a lot of the thought process of a decision goes out of the window and it becomes a different kind of process, just comparing an AI's output. I do feel this fundamentally changes something about how we arrive at decisions using evidence and statistics.

It's not how I use purposely AI myself that affects my decision making or stresses me, it's the ever present use of it in all forms of interaction that I require to make with any company or service provider. Wading through endless chat bots or AI systems is wearing, annoying and time consuming.

boost clarity by handling routine tasks, but they can also scatter attention and shrink the space for reflection. They make choices feel easier, though that convenience can weaken slower, more deliberate judgment. They help when used with limits, but without limits they keep the mind active when it needs to rest.

I use it carefully to sense check or proof read content that I have generated myself.  It is very good to help edit down wordy content, or to adapt it to specific audiences and I always check that it has not changed the meaning or added/removed content that I did not want it to.  Like anything else (spellcheck, autocomplete, transcriptions etc) it is a tool in the toolbox and you need to understand what it can and can't do and quality check the results.

I feel like AI takes away my ability to exercise mental muscles, to keep functions such as original thinking and understanding processes through doing in tact. I worry that the demand to use AI will result in me relying on it to think for me, and strip me of the ability to think unique thoughts or produce original work; it somehow takes away my joy and sense of achievement I felt in the past in completing a task and producing useful results for a business myself, when the AI can do most of the work.
I think that right now AI just enhances what I provide but doesn’t take over or impact my ability to think clearly or make decisions/
it makes me less competent in making my own decisions and performing actions.
it does not impact me
I have become too reliant on AI tools and this has negatively impacted my ability to think and act independently and autonomously.  This has resulted in heightened anxiety.
It doesn't, I don't know how it could actually do that for anyone.

AI tools are tools. I use them the same ways I use other tools. I translate screenshots with them. I correct grammar with them (not here :) ), I ask for recipes and so on. It would be weird to ask it for personal advice or start pouring my soul into computer. I use it as a tool and it is a great time saver compare to google. If its starts lying or pushing decisions - opening a new window usually solves a problem
Using AI helps to keep my thoughts organized.
I really need breaks from screens in general and I use screen for digital and AI tools so I just need a break to rest my eyes and head sometimes.

It does depend on what purpose you're using AI for in my view and therefore the trustworthiness of the results obtained. I would always take each case individually to assess how to use the results and whether or not to accept them on face value or the need for further research.
I don't think it does, it just allows me to process and generate more output
I need it to make sense of my thoughts and ideas. It helps me make decisions, which frees up my mind, and I then have confidence to do other things, away from screen and AI
I dont think it affects my ability to think clearly. In a way I think that it actually helps me think more clearly because Im more aware
I feel like i always need to be switched on when using AI, I also feel like I need to proof read answers and even fact check

The models provide different answers to the same queries and also require multiple follow up questions to provide useful answers. You also have to fact check anything that's questionable or highly important.  After awhile, you're mentally exhausted and full of doubt while still needing and craving reliable information. You blame yourself for not being smart enough to use AI models

i like using it to summarise large amounts of data in a concise way that helps me make choices, so it can be helpful, however on occasion i have noticed the summaries produced are not always accurate or are missing context so i still need to have a good grounded understanding of the source data

If used in moderation AI tools don't really have much of an effect on my ability to think clear, but after using them for extensive periods of time it can become harder to distinguish at times between your own thoughts and those you have seen as responses via AI tools.
I don’t have any issues as I’m not a digital tool user. But I can imagine if it doesn’t understand the question it could be frustrating, tech is great when it works.

When tools handle tasks like summarizing, calculating, or organizing, your mind has more space for deeper reasoning, creativity, or reflection. It’s like clearing mental clutter so you can focus on the parts that matter.
I use it more of an aide then trusting on it solely. It doesnt effect my feelings but helps back up maybe what im feeling
Using AI tools although it saves time is very mentally overloading

I always view AI as my own personal knowledgeable assistant, who works 24/7 without tiring or complaining. I can choose what I do myself and what I delegate. I can choose whether to listen to AI or to ignore it. I see using AI as a symbiotic relationship where I gain by being freed from the majority of research work and base analyses. I am freed up to focus on QA over AI feedback, and then deciding whether I need to research/analyze further before making a decision myself. I find this approach stimulating, reassuring and comforting; I can rest my mind when wanted and then employ my full brain power when needed.
I'm really not affected by it.

I have very clear and set boundaries that I do not cross so it doesn't. But I do understand and have personally felt the potential for this to happen, when I first started using AI. But I then learned what it is really useful for which is moreso things like framing and giving you structure instead of actual judgement of quality of things.

column2: Unemployed and not currently looking for work
column24: AI tools could assist to make decision more effectively
It doesn't affect me because I'm not dependent on AI or any digital tools.
few of the but just one i use regularly
The overload of input from using a phone and apps clutters my already cluttered mind even more, its as if all the tabs are never closed, but multiplied.

I don’t really have too much of an issue in thinking clearly, making decisions  or resting my mind after using AI but there are times when I feel that it improves my confidence when I do so and I’m less sure of myself without it sometimes
It is sometimes difficult to determine if the AI interpreted my question correctly and has provided a plausible answer.
I avoid AI use as much as possible. AI makes me furious. I do feel  irritated by how hard it is to avoid now.

Using digital and AI tools helps with efficiency, but constant interaction can cloud my thinking and make decisions feel less grounded. It becomes harder to fully switch off, and I often need deliberate breaks to regain mental clarity and focus.

I use AI in my work sometimes to help with wording emails that might need a little extra attention. I also use it for some data analysis but have to be careful about the results I get because it’s not always accurate.

AI greatly enhances my ability to write succintly and clearly and that's how I use it mainly at work. Personally, I use it for recipes and miscellaneous queries. I'm always able to think clearly and make my own decisions. It rests my mind by saving me time.
Sometimes I feel like when AI generates output there is so much detail that it becomes very overwhelming which affects my ability to think clearly, make decisions and rest my mind.
It makes it easier for me to remember good ideas and to make decisions. And offers conceptual clarity and distinctions, making me think clearly.

column2: Unable to work due to illness or disability
column24: Often AI gives an extremely long answer which takes a long time to read and could be answered more succinctly.   It's annoying to need to check every video, photo, or post that I see on social media to tell whether it's AI-generated or not, so the better it gets, the more alienated I feel, as it blurs reality vs propaganda.  Google AI overview is often wrong or extremely biased and there's no way to turn it off, and it's hard to ignore, which is worrying.
It has no effect because I do not rely on AI in my business or personal life
Some times instead of thinking I let AI trigger a thought and ideas then I follow thorough
I honestly don’t think it effects it but I do rely on it more and find myself not trying to think as hard

I generally use it to double check things I already think are the case, or to check variances in documents. Therefore I find it really helps me organise my thoughts and be more confident with my assertions. It doesn’t stress me out or worry me.
Depending on what I am doing AI can boost my creativity and give me new ideas for me to explore
It can just make me second guess myself sometimes when I have to make a decision on my own. I find myself wondering what AI would say

I find it draining and unpersonal as well as making me feel lazy since in the past I always preferred to use my own brain when working on a task, whereas now my job requires me to use it on a regular basis which clashes with what I think of AI in general (not very positively)
I can get more anxious about making decisions and wonder  if what I'm doing is good enough. It's also easy to be too reliant on AI and not check the results well enough because I want to save time.

Using digital and AI tools helps me find information quickly and solve problems easily. However, too much can distract me, make thinking harder and disrupt my sleep. When I use them wisely, they improve my decision making. Overuse makes it harder to rest my mind.
I feel it encourages me to refine my ideas, which makes me think more.
it helps me to make decisions and to think more clearly. it does also sometimes help me to rest my mind.
Whenever I use AI and it gives me advice that doesn’t turn out good it messes with my thoughts and mind.

Using digital and AI tools helps me think and decide faster, but it can also make my mind feel crowded if I rely on them too much. They’re useful for organizing information, yet sometimes I need to step away from screens to think clearly and give my mind a break.
it makes me doubt myself
often the information given is not clear or needs more information. so it affects coming to decisions or completing tasks
It’s just so much screen basically
Using AI supports my reasoning and thinking process when making every decision.
You become automated in the information that you are gathering and not all outcomes is based on your own information
It's not so much thinking clearly, but rather what you hinted at, that my decisions feel slighlty less mine because AI was involved in the process. This feels scary.

AI tools confuse me a lot as they often have imputs I want but also imputs I do not like so it makes me stress out sometimes and making decisions becomes harder because I do not know whom to trust anymore.
using AI tools helps me to see things in different ways. it helps me make decisions faster
It helps me to manage daily tasks in everyday life so I can focus more on other things and tasks.
Sometime I become less confident in my own decision making abilities.
AI tools can make it difficult to tell what is authentic or legitimate in online spaces where it can easily masquerade as human. This can lead to a general distrust in art and writing.

Using digital or AI tools helps me think more clearly by walking me through the thought process of how we arrived at the answer and why it makes sense.It helps me make decisions usually by providing many thoughts, sides, or perspectives on things that I may not have thought of. Then, I can better make my choice or decision because I have more information or perspectives on the subject. I wouldn't say AI or digital tools rest my mind, per say. I do feel like it lessens the load and allows me to use less brain power, which makes the whole thing easier and less stressful.
it helps me make decisions and think clearer as it explains all aspects of the decision i ask it to tell me more about.

Using AI tools like chat GPT does not affect my ability to think clearly if anything is helps me make decisions regarding purchasing items or deciding how to do something. I actually find using chat GPT allows my mind to be cleared rather than spending ages thinking about something I can get a quick answer from chance GPT and then can move on.
I think AI makes decision making easier in general which makes everything more clear.

I don't trust AI, and I don't trust people who use AI. I make fun of AI whenever I do a survey with AI chatbot in it. The liberal bias is obvious. Woke is written into it, and I pity people who need woke AI to tell them how to think. I prefer to use my own mind. I can think for myself.

column24: i have only used for studies that required me so don't have much experience although think they are good

I can confidently say that AI has no impact on my ability to think or make decisions.  I use it only as an aid, and to assist with drafting or answer a problem for me, but generally I prefer to rely on my own reasoning abilities.
If I don't check every little thing, there's uncertainty about using it.
I think when I use AI tools too much I become less focused on the smaller details because I think that the AI will take care of it and that can lead to some oversight.

AI output isn't always accurate, and it doesn't always understand exactly what you are looking for, and being alert for this and double checking is time consuming and tiring. Even so, AI doesn't impact my ability to think clearly, or 'think for myself'.
I sometimes question where the AI information actually comes from and whether it truly is reliable. I would rather just be able to trust it.
It affects my critical thinking
If anything it makes me think less then I start ton worry that I am not using my own mind and just trying to put the load onto AI and take a back seat

I appreciate using digital and AI tools. It helps me to not think so hard. My daily work requires a lot of research and figuring out problems. AI is a big help to me and allows me to get my work done faster and to give my brain a break.
Well you feel as if your decisions aren’t yours, they are not unique to you, you know yourself better than anyone does and this can make you question your ability to think freely

AI has been significant in automatic mundane tasks and helped me develop med-legal writing to better write progress notes. However, I would have had a different perspective three weeks ago.
using AI makes me question some of my choices and decisions
AI supports my own decision making process but never dominates.
it all depends on the scenario

Personally it has no affect on me other than I just deeply hate using it. I only touch that useless shit because it's required at work.

I think AI got me personally is to just get a better understanding of something, or assist with wording. It can sometimes make you question ideas but i don’t believe it has a big affect on my mind
Using AI tools over a long period of time makes your brain lazy and slow. It makes you second guess your sentences
Using AI forces me to think through what I am actually trying to achieve so I can articulate it in prompts
I worry the AI system is not giving me the correct information so it's gives me anxiety

It gives me more confidence towards the decisions I am already making. At first I depended on it too heavily then realized I need to take my time and teach it, ever since then I have found a niche for it.
Using AI tools don't really affect my ability to think clearly or make decisions I use it as a supplement and aid
Using digital or AI tools helps me make quicker decisions, but constant use can clutter my mind and make it harder to fully switch off
we rely Alon AI to find info quicker, we rely more and more on AI and we become more and more lazy

Using digital and AI tools helps me get information quickly, but sometimes it makes my mind feel tired. I have to think a lot about whether the information is correct and how to ask the right questions. This can make it harder to think clearly or relax. Even though the tools are useful, they can also add extra mental effort.
It creates this high level of dependence. You tend to rely on it for virtually every thinking task even ones you would originally easily complete on your own
It really hasn't affected much so far. I think the only thing is maybe I might want to get a second opinion using an ai tool before making a big decision.

AI is useful as a general guide and provide alternate paths to pursue, it is good for brainstorming ideas and as a shorthand to check general information on a topic to provide an overview. I feel I can gain a quick overall grasp of an unfamiliar topic and there is a sense of overconfidence in thinking that it is a solid grasp. I sometimes make decisions based on what AI says but if the decision is an important one I will seek further information at the source and get a second or more opinions.
I don't think it affects me negatively. Instead it helps me with suggestions helping me feel more confident in what I was looking for.
It makes me less confident about making my own decisions. But also saves me time
It doesn't. I question everything, AI is useful but it's far from perfect. I use it to save time, but often I need to do my own research to make sure facts are correct.
I do not have any issues with using AI and feel it has no negative impacts on my thinking of decisions

I think any screen time (AI included) keeps your brain active and "buzzing" so harder to powder down/switch off. In terms of decision making, I find myself worrying that I begin to rely more and more on AI so it erodes my ability to make any decision myself without AI back up

Using digital and AI tools helps me process information quickly and offload some decisions, freeing up mental space. However, constant notifications and inputs can fragment my focus and make it harder to rest my mind.
Using digital or AI tools can make it easier for me to think clearly because they help organize information, explain complex ideas, and offer quick guidance when I feel stuck.
